page.title: 14Employment,Wick
page.content: The North of Scotland Milk Marketing Board employs a staff of 46.It produces 24000 pints of milk daily collected by two tankers from 14 farms.They deliver as far west as Dounreay and south to Berriedale. In the past year they have changed from bottles to cartons for economic reasons.They pasteurise 1000 gallons of milk per hour and 35 cartons are filled per minute.Milk is delivered daily to each household in the town. John O'Groats Laundry,which was built in 1911, now employs 28 people,6 men and 22 women.This is perhaps the only establishment where workers clock in and out daily. The Co-operative Supermarket,which opened 10 years ago,employs a staff of 31.
